content: phoenix throw 3 sizes super easy quick to knit and easily customized this throw was designed to highlight and tame the long color repeats in yarns like noro inspired by the noro striped scarf the blanket is knit flat using mostly knit stitch 1 row purl 5 row knit gauge is not important in this project as long as you are happy with the size of the blanket and feel of the fabric the sample was made in the lap robe size 400 grams of knit picks chroma in color groovy color a and 200 grams knit picks chroma twist bulky in color pegasus color b the results are most dramatic when the colorways are quite different from each other you can also use solids variegates or any combination you like i recommend washable yarn as it is knit rather loosely and has the potential to grow significantly if wet blocked other good yarn choices include j c brett s marble chunky and hayfield spirit chunky step 1 choose your size - sizes listed below are standard sizes for each type of throw - you are free to knit to any size you desire baby blanket - about 25x30 inches 63x76 cm lap blanket - about 35x40 inches 89x102 cm throw - about 50x60 inches 127x152 cm step 2 gather your notions you will need scissors darning needle tape measure step 3 - choose your materials you will need about twice as much of color a as color b yarn is chunky or bulky weight baby blanket - 288 yards 263 m color a 144 yards 132 m color b lap blanket - 500 yards 457 m color a 250 yards 229 m color b throw - 1200 yards 1097m color a 600 yards 549 m color b step 4 get your needles blanket is knit back and forth on circular needles us size 11 8mm needles - 24 inch 60 cm will work for baby blanket others need 29 inch 74 cm or longer o feel free to swatch on different size needles to get a fabric you like - just make sure you cast on enough stitches to get the width you want or close to it pattern works for any stitch count any gauge step 5 cast on and set up cast on 75 95 135 stitches with color a use any cast on you prefer for an especially nice finish use the icord cast on and the i cord bind off the pick up method of icord cast on works best for this project the slipped stitches at the end of each setup row 1 k to 3 before end sl3 with yarn in front row will form an icord edge which setup row 2 k to 3 before end sl3 with yarn in front gives a neat rolled appearance it also setup row 3 k to 3 before end sl3 with yarn in front conveniently hides where you carry your yarn up the sides when
